name: Duke Pre-College Programs
description: A variety of Duke-hosted summer programs that help students strengthen academic skills through interactive learning, teamwork, and exposure to new fields of study.

name: NCSSM Summer Accelerator
description: An intensive summer learning experience offering challenging STEM-focused courses taught by experts, where students collaborate with peers and engage in real-world applications.

name: NCSSM Summer Ventures
description: A fully funded summer program for academically strong North Carolina students that emphasizes hands-on research, university-level learning, and exploration of STEM career paths.

name: NCSSM INSPIRE
description: A research-focused summer program that introduces students from diverse backgrounds to STEM fields while building leadership skills and experience solving complex, real-world challenges.

name: EXPLORE@UNC
description: A one-week residential program that allows high school students to experience college life, sample academic subjects, and reflect on potential majors and career interests.

name: NC State Engineering Residential Camps
description: A residential summer experience where students live on campus at NC State while exploring a specific engineering discipline through hands-on projects and college-style learning.

name: NC State Engineering Day Camps
description: Week-long, non-residential engineering camps that introduce younger high school students to how engineers approach problem-solving across multiple disciplines.

name: UNC Chapel Hill Dual Enrollment
description: Eligible honor roll high school juniors may apply to take UNC summer courses as visiting students through the university’s Summer School program.

name: NC State College of Engineering Summer Research Experience
description: The Electrical and Computing Engineering Department at North Carolina State University is hosting a Young Scholars program for high school students from June 22 to July 20, 2026. Students will work with teachers and researchers to create and test lessons connected to current engineering research, including applied artificial intelligence.

name: Project SEED
description: This program supports high school students from diverse backgrounds by offering hands-on STEM learning and chemistry research opportunities. It provides summer research placements and virtual camps that focus on college readiness, lab skills, and exposure to chemistry careers.

name: Leadership Institute for Future Teachers (LIFT)
description: The Leadership Institute for Future Teachers (LIFT) is a six-day invitational program for rising North Carolina high school seniors interested in education, offering hands-on school experiences and exposure to education careers.

name: UNC School of the Arts Summer Intensives
description: The University of North Carolina School of the Arts offers immersive summer programs for middle and high school students across disciplines such as animation, dance, drama, film, music, and visual arts. Programs include hands-on training, performances, and instruction from professional artists, with additional online academic options and community camps available.

name: North Carolina Governor’s School
description: A prestigious, tuition-free residential summer program recognizing academic excellence in humanities, social sciences, and STEM.

name: Durham YouthWorks
description: Durham YouthWorks is a hybrid program that helps young adults build essential skills and explore career opportunities with local employers while earning stipends for participation.

name: Carolina Sports Journalism Camp
description: The Carolina Sports Journalism Camp at UNC-Chapel Hill is a program for rising high school juniors and seniors interested in sports and media, offering hands-on training in sports writing, broadcasting, photography, and newsroom practice.

name: Chuck Stone Program
description: The 2026 Chuck Stone Program is a four-day, in-person journalism workshop for rising high school seniors, offering hands-on reporting, newsroom practice, and mentorship while producing a collaborative multimedia publication.

name: NC State Design Camp
description: Design Camp is a pre-college summer program by NC State’s Design Lab that introduces middle and high school students to design thinking and its real-world impact through hands-on, creative experiences.

name: Horticultural Science Summer Institute
description: The Horticultural Science Summer Institute at NC State is a hands-on, residential program where high school students explore plant science, sustainable agriculture, and horticulture careers through workshops, field visits, and campus life experiences.

name: NC State Study Skills
description: The NC State Psychoeducational Clinic offers in-person and online programs that help students improve organization, study skills, and academic habits.

name: NC State Teen Writers Workshop
description: The Teen Writers Workshop is a two-week summer program that supports creative writing development and connects students with a community of young writers.

name: NC GlaxoSmithKline Foundation Program in Biotech
description: The North Carolina GlaxoSmithKline Scholars Program supports biology majors at UNC Asheville who demonstrate academic excellence and financial need, with a focus on undergraduate research in fields such as cell biology, biochemistry, and molecular biology.

name: Durham Public Schools Scholars-At-Work Program
description: The DPS Scholars-At-Work Program offers Durham Public Schools students in grades 10–12 a short-term workplace immersion experience, providing hands-on exposure to local companies and career paths.

name: Durham Aquatic School Lifeguard Instructor
description: DAS provides free lifeguard certification training for individuals ages 16 and older, preparing participants for aquatics careers and recruitment for lifeguard positions at DPR indoor and outdoor pools.

name: Durham Aquatic School Water Safety Instructor
description: This course certifies participants ages 15 and older to teach American Red Cross water safety and Learn-to-Swim programs. Certification requires passing a swim skills pre-test and completing the Red Cross online coursework.

name: Launching Emerging Employees Progarm (LEEP)
description: The LEEP program supports youth through paid entry-level jobs and career development, combining hands-on work with weekly soft-skills training across multiple Durham County Government departments.

name: MaryAnn Black Summer Internship
description: The MaryAnn Black Summer Internship Program offers students hands-on exposure to over 70 healthcare careers through hospital visits, interactive sessions, and skill-building workshops. Hosted by Duke Health with Durham YouthWorks, the program includes mentorship from Duke professionals and introduces career pathways across medicine and nursing.

name: Duke University Neuroscience Experience (DUNE)
description: DUNE provides local high school students with full-time, paid summer research opportunities in neuroscience labs at Duke University, offering hands-on experience, professional development, and mentorship, with no prior research experience required.

name: NC State College of Natural Resources High School Summer Research Program
description: This program at NC State introduces high school students to forestry and natural resources through mentorship, career exploration, and research exposure, including seminars and participation in NC State’s Research and Creativity Symposium.

name: Duke's STAR Program
description: The STAR Program is a six-week, full-time summer experience at Duke that immerses students in academic and clinical research. Participants work with faculty mentors to conduct research, develop a paper, attend research-focused lectures and workshops, and present their findings, with optional physician shadowing for eligible students.

name: UNC’s Nutrition Research Virtual Internship Program
description: This four-week virtual program engages students from rising 9th grade through rising college freshman in lectures, mentoring, and scientific skill-building with NRI researchers. Participants create and present scientific posters on a chosen nutrition topic, gaining experience in communicating research findings.

name: North Carolina Agricultural and Technical State University’s Research Apprenticeship Program
description: This two-week residential summer program at North Carolina A&T immerses rising juniors and seniors in food, agricultural, and environmental sciences through hands-on research with faculty mentors. Students live on campus, explore Greensboro’s cultural landmarks, receive a stipend upon completion, and pay only a small application fee.

name: Youth Conservation Crews
description: Youth Conservation Crews offer teens ages 15–18 paid summer opportunities to work on hands-on conservation projects across the state. Crews run for 3–6 weeks during June–August, with small teams led by trained crew leaders.

name: Duke Research in Engineering Program (DukeREP)
description: DukeREP is a seven-week, in-person research program that places students in Duke Biomedical Engineering labs for hands-on research with faculty and graduate mentors. The program includes seminars, workshops, and networking opportunities, with a focus on expanding STEM access for students from underrepresented and economically disadvantaged backgrounds.

name: Durham Sports Commission Internship Program
description: The Durham Sports Commission offers internship opportunities for students interested in gaining hands-on experience in the sports industry through business tactics.

name: NC State VetCAMP
description: VetCAMP is a five-day summer program at North Carolina State University run by the Veterinary Professions Advising Center that introduces students to careers in veterinary medicine. Since 2011, the camp has offered hands-on experiences such as animal clinics, livestock work, suture and dissection labs, tours of the College of Veterinary Medicine, and exploration of related NC State majors.

name: Teens Art Council North Carolina Museum of Art
description: The NCMA Teen Arts Council is a group of teen ambassadors who meet weekly from September through June. Members help plan teen takeovers and art exhibitions, participate in artist workshops, attend museum events, and explore careers in the arts.

name: North Carolina Museum of Natural Sciences: Junior Interpreters Program
description: As a Junior Interpreter, you serve as a museum ambassador by engaging visitors with hands-on science and real specimens on the museum floor. The program builds strong communication, public speaking, and customer service skills while providing practical experience in science education and outreach.

name: NC State Resource Conservation Workshop
description: The Resource Conservation Workshop is a weeklong, application-based program that immerses students in hands-on learning about natural resources and environmental management. Participants engage in field studies, tours, and career-focused activities, with opportunities to earn awards and scholarships.

name: Teen X-Treme Summer Camp
description: Teen X-Treme is a summer camp for ages 12–14 that offers a fun, interactive curriculum including arts and crafts, indoor and outdoor games, and character and leadership development activities. Participants attend daily and bring their own lunch and snacks.
